channel.title: Error when running the server
channel.description:
[code]Error: missing `server' JVM at `C:\Program Files (x86)\java\jre1.8.0_65\bin\server\jvm.dll'. Please install or use the JRE or JDK that contains these missing components. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I really have no idea what to do and eclipse doesn't work on my computer

item.title: Error when running the server
item.dc:creator: @loliateyourcat loliateyourcat
item.description:
@loliateyourcat wrote:

Only ironic to a simple mind.

To put it in more simple terms for a person such as yourself. The reference I made “This is an easy fix” was correct, it was a very easy fix once I figured out how to do it and how you found any relevance regarding where or how I achieved this fix is a wonder.

You sir, are a tool. Good day.

Read full topic

item.title: Error when running the server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“loliateyourcat, post:2, topic:553765”]This is an easy fix.

Here is how you do it:

  1. Go to your java files on your (C:) drive - OS (C:) > Program files (x86) > java > bin.

  2. Now make a new folder and name it “server”.

  3. Now go to C: > Program files or Program files (x86) > java > jdk8 or jre8 > bin > client folder.

  4. Copy all the data of this folder into the new C: > Program files (x86) > java > jre8 > bin > server.

  5. Done.

~Cheers.[/quote]
Found it kind of ironic you say that when you just ran into this problem:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:553761”]I assume this would be your fix:

stackoverflow.com

Missing `server' JVM (Java\jre7\bin\server\jvm.dll.)

java, dll, jvm
asked by Rushik Parikh on 10:02AM - 08 Aug 13 UTC

But obviously with your version of java[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Error when running the server
item.dc:creator: @loliateyourcat loliateyourcat
item.description:
@loliateyourcat wrote:

This is an easy fix.

Here is how you do it:

  1. Go to your java files on your (C:) drive - OS (C:) > Program files (x86) > java > bin.

  2. Now make a new folder and name it “server”.

  3. Now go to C: > Program files or Program files (x86) > java > jdk8 or jre8 > bin > client folder.

  4. Copy all the data of this folder into the new C: > Program files (x86) > java > jre8 > bin > server.

  5. Done.

~Cheers.

Read full topic
